perturbation.original_text:
Payment of License Fees shall be made in Canadian funds in arrears within thirty (30) days following each calendar month during
the Term in which Licensed Programs were exhibited hereunder and shall be accompanied by a statement of account showing the
calculation of the License Fees.
perturbation.changed_text:
Payment of License Fees shall be made in Canadian funds in arrears within sixty (60) days following each calendar month during
the Term in which Licensed Programs were exhibited hereunder and shall be accompanied by a statement of account showing the
calculation of the License Fees.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment deadline for license fees. The original text specifies 30 days, while the modified version states 60 days, creating ambiguity and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
Licensor shall reimburse Rogers for 50% of any such royalties actually paid by Rogers, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable
monthly. This Section shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
Licensor shall reimburse Rogers for 25% of any such royalties actually paid by Rogers, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable
quarterly. This Section shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a direct numerical contradiction regarding the percentage of copyright royalties to be reimbursed and the period of payment. Previously stated as 50% payable monthly, now it is 25% payable quarterly, creating uncertainty and affecting the financial obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Rogers may terminate this Agreement, at any time, upon sixty (60) days’ prior
written notice to Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text:
Rogers may terminate this Agreement, at any time, upon thirty (30) days’ prior
written notice to Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: This change alters the notice period required for termination by Rogers. The original text requires 60 days' notice, while the altered text states 30 days' notice, resulting in conflicting instructions regarding the termination procedure.
